original: Lindahl, Sture, överstelöjtnant v. kustart., Karlskrona, f. 18/10/01 i Malmö av bankdir. Otto o. Alma L. G. 34 m. Stina Margareta Pontin. Barn: Björn f. 37, Christer 40, Jan 43, Ulf 46. — Stud:ex. 21, off:ex. 24, KSHS 28, kurs v. radiostat. 29, v. telegraf v. 38. Fänrik v. kustart. 24, löjtn. 26, kapt. 36, major 42, öv:löjtn. 46. Reg:-adjut. v. KA.2 32-36, adjut. i kommen-d:staben i Karlskrona fästn. 37, i ma-rindistr :staben v. Sydkustens marin-distr. 38, ställd t. ch. f. KA.3 förfog. 1. uppsättn. av Gotl. kustart :försvar o. KA.3 38, stabsch. v. Gotl. kustart :-försvar 38-43, avd :ch. i kustart :insp. 43-46, stabsch. v. Blek. kustart :försvar sed. 46. Instruktör v. Karlskrona friv. motorbåts flottilj 25-38 o. Kalmarsunds dito 35-38, mil. led. samt repr. f. marinen i styr. f. Gotl. dito 40-43, bitr. v. utarb. av förslag t. förbind :instr. f. kustart. 32-33, utsedd att ss. chefens f. marinen repr. stå t. statens sakrev. förfog, f. viss utredn. 44-45, utsedd att inom marinstaben bitr. m. utarb. av förslag t. nytt regi. f. marinen 44, förordn. ss. medl. av marinens dimbildn :komm. 45-46, ss. repr. f. försv:väs. i styr. f. Blek. RK-distr. 46. Stud:vist. v. finska kustart. 40. RSO, RVO, Sv:es friv. motorbåtskårs förtjSM, Karlskrona friv. motorbåtsflottiljs förtjGM.
translated: Lindahl, Sture, Lieutenant Colonel of Coastal Artillery, Karlskrona, b. 18/10/01 in Malmö to Bank Director Otto and Alma L. G. Married to Stina Margareta Pontin in 1934. Children: Björn b. 1937, Christer b. 1940, Jan b. 1943, Ulf b. 1946. Completed studentexamen (high school diploma) in 1921, officer's examination in 1924, KSSS (Coastal Artillery Staff Course) in 1928, radio station course in 1929, telegraph course in 1938. Promoted to Ensign in Coastal Artillery in 1924, Lieutenant in 1926, Captain in 1936, Major in 1942, Lieutenant Colonel in 1946. Regimental Adjutant of Coastal Artillery Regiment 2 from 1932-1936, Adjutant in the Command Staff at Karlskrona Fortress in 1937, in the Naval District Staff of the South Coast Naval District from 1938, temporarily assigned as Commander of Coastal Artillery Regiment 3 and Coastal Artillery Regiment of Gotland from 1938, Staff Officer in Gotland Coastal Artillery Defense from 1938 to 1943, Division Commander of Coastal Artillery Inspection from 1943-1946, Staff Officer in Blekinge Coastal Artillery Defense since 1946. Instructor in Karlskrona Volunteer Motorboat Flotilla from 1925-1938 and Kalmarsund Volunteer Motorboat Flotilla from 1935-1938, military leader and representative for the Navy in the board of Gotland Volunteer Motorboat Flotilla from 1940-1943, assistant in the development of proposals for communication instructions for Coastal Artillery from 1932-1933, appointed as representative for the Navy in the State Archive Authority for certain investigations from 1944-1945, appointed to assist in the development of proposals for a new regulation for the Navy in 1944, appointed as member of the Navy's image commission from 1945-1946, representative for Defense Material Administration in the board of Blekinge Naval District in 1946. Studied at the Finnish Coastal Artillery in 1940. Recipient of the Royal Order of the Sword, Royal Order of Vasa, Swedish Volunteer Motorboat Corps Merit Medal, Karlskrona Volunteer Motorboat Flotilla's Merit Medal.
